Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a long round-topped and round-tipped nozzle, and a small depressed discus defined by a groove and a raised rounded edge. The shoulder is decorated with short radiating grooves. The circular base is concave within and has a groove round the edge. On the left side is a lug, perhaps in the form of a dolphin, and on top of the nozzle is an indistinct decorative feature. Traces of a purple-brown slip remain.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q586)
